name: No quality
effect: Does nothing!

name: Antistatus
effect: You are immune to a single status effect.

name: Resistance
effect: You have Resistance to a single damage type (not physical damage).

name: Dual Resistance
effect: You have Resistance to two damage types (not physical damage).

name: Swordbreaker
effect: You have Resistance to physical damage.

name: Immunity
effect: You have Immunity to a single damage type (not physical damage).

name: Perfect Health
effect: You are immune to all status effects.

name: Initiative Up
effect: You gain a +4 bonus to your Initiative modifier.

name: Accuracy Up
effect: You gain a +1 bonus to your Accuracy Checks.

name: Magic Up
effect: You gain a +1 bonus to your Magic Checks.

name: Vitality Up
effect: When you recover HP, you recover 5 extra HP.

name: Healing Up
effect: Spells you cast that whose effects restore Hit Points will restore 5 extra Hit Points.

name: Spell Up
effect: Spells you cast deal 5 extra damage.

name: Weapon Up
effect: Your attacks with (choose one: melee, ranged) weapons deal 5 extra damage.

name: Refreshing Brew
effect: When a potion or magisphere created with your Inventory Points restore Mind Points, restores 5 extra Mind Points.

name: Spellweaven
effect: Choose a spell or skill that costs 10 MP. That spell now only costs 5 MP to cast.

name: Weapon Expertise
effect: Choose one of the following weapon groups: brawling weapons, daggers or thrown. You deal 5 extra damage with those weapons.

name: Soothing
effect: When you receive healing, you regain 5 more Hit Points.

name: Meditiative
effect: When you regain Mind Points, you regain 5 more.

name: Power Pool
effect: The item may hold a maximum of 20 MP, which you can charge during a rest.

name: Guard Channel
effect: When you take the guard action and do not choose to cover a target, the next spell you cast has its MP cost halved.

name: Protective
effect: At the start of a conflict, gain 15 shields (shields do not accumulate; use the best source of shields).

name: Potent Brew
effect: When a potion or magisphere created with your Inventory Points restore Hit Points, restores 5 extra Hit Points.
